result.execSummary:
The defendant John R. Martin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: BOND APPLIED - fine pd in full.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John R. Martin

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Carmen Lassiter.  Case is resolved.  Park enhancer dismissed on State's motion.  Deft pleads guilty to the charge as amended; found guilty by the Court.  Parties waive PSI.  Sentencing arguments made.  Deft fined $250 plus costs.  Bond to apply.  Balance may be returned to poster.  DNA ordered; notice given to deft.  Bond forfeiture is vacated.
Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Carmen Lassiter.  No action taken today on bond forfeiture - will be addressed at conclusion of case.

2:02  Special Prosecutor Attorney Jerrold Hinshaw appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney C Lassiter. Clerk LE.   Warrant vacated. Referred to Br 3 for further disposition on 6-10-15 @ 9:20 am FPT. JS selection 7-20-15 @ 9:00 am  $2500.00 Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).

*Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.
961.41(3g)(e) -Poss of THC -2nd & Subsequent, Repeater, On or Near Certain Places
Warrant served, def. in custody.  Return on warrant today at 1:00 before Intake Commissioner.
Minutes:   NO RECORD.  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  No appearance by deft or Atty Carmen Lassiter.  Per court - issue bench warrant.

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Atty Carmen Lassiter appeared for def.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Def. did not appear; is at work.  Signature bond ordered forfeited.  Bench warrant authorized; bond set at $2,500.00 cash.  All orders stayed until status conf. on 3/20/15 at 9:00.

252pm
  Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney C Lassiter.  Clerk LE.  Referred to Br 3 for further dispo on 3/19/15 @ 130pm - FPT.  Deft waives prlim hrg.  Probable cause found.  Bound over to Br 3.  Jury selection on 4/27/15 @ 900am.  Atty Lassiter already has trial in Br 6 on this date.  Info filed.  Not guilty plea entered.

Of Prelim Hrg
Submitted by Atty C Lassiter

Final pre-trial on March 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Jury selection on April 27, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State. Def. appeared by Atty. Carmen Lassiter. Clerk LE. No appearance by def. Atty. Lassiter reports her client mistakenly thought he had court at 1:00 today and has no ride until then. Court wants def. present today at 1:00pm.

Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 20 days; set before Commissioner on 1/8/15 @ 9 a.m.  Court excuses def's attendance at today's hearing & schedules prelim hearing with Atty.  Bond - Continued.
Preliminary hearing on January 8, 2015 at 09:00 am.
